author: nflaig
content:
will have a separate PR to discuss how the self-building flow would look, I believe we need both stateless and stateful, tbd on what's the default behavior, might not even define that in the spec and require validator clients to decide that via query param

I am not entirely sure how the one for builders should look like, if we don't wanna pass transactions around don't we need a `BlindedExecutionPayloadEnvelope`?

as for what data the builder needs to send to the beacon node, I believe execution requests would be enough to run the state transition and compute the state root

but overall not clear to me yet what data types the api would use

author: potuz
content: Getting a blinded payload envelope from a beacon node is a can of worms. In principle it's absolutely fine as long as it's not self building (that is the builder index is being actually served by the node) but I can already hear the drums of clients saying they'll support  this or that shady protocol in detriment of client diversity to prevent forks, pools running builder indices to circumvent the non-self-building condition, etc
